programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: The shelter is invited to the Dog Bowl, which provides an amazing opportunity for rescues to get adopted. A couple are looking to adopt their first dog

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Lucas Congdon revisits five of his favourite builds and families. He and his team reveal their never-before-seen, most outrageous backyard creations

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Lucas builds a giant pool for a friend. He creates a dream backyard with a dock, large cascading waterfalls, firepit and an audio-visual entertainment bar you can swim up to

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson heads to the Bella Rose plantation in Virginia, where he builds a luxurious Thomas Jefferson-inspired treehouse complete with colonial columns

programme.title: Little Giants

programme.title: Little Giants

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto buries a giant water tank to solve a few shortage issues. Atz Lee and Atz Sr seek out a black bear, and Eivin builds a survival motorbike fitted with weapons

programme.title: Fish or Die

programme.sub-title: The Secret of the Red Shed
programme.desc: The hunters track down one of the mysterious cloaked figures at the heart of the Spearfinger mystery. However, the red shed might hold all the answers

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James gets caught in a feud between Oliver and Roland Strong, who have not spoken to each other for 50 years. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: A confectioners beloved cat falls victim to a mystery illness that defies all Jamess attempts to find a cure. Rural drama, with Robert Hardy, Christopher Timothy and Geoffrey Bayldon

programme.title: Ian McNeice Remembers - Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Actor Ian McNeice reminisces on his time as agent Harcourt in the BBC 1985 political crime thriller Edge of Darkness

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Policeman Ronald Craven is in the midst of investigating a union election scandal when his daughter Emma is shot and killed in front of him at their home. Learning of her involvement in an ecological group and absolutely determined to trace her killer, Craven goes to London to investigate. First part of Troy Kennedy Martins 1985 political thriller, starring Bob Peck in a Bafta-winning role, with Joanne Whalley, Joe Don Baker and Ian McNeice

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Emmas killer is trapped - but Craven is unable to discover the reason for her death before hes shot, and a meeting with CIA agent Darius Jedburgh convinces the grieving father there are deeper conspiracies to be uncovered. Troy Kennedy Martins nuclear thriller, with Bob Peck and Joanne Whalley

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.sub-title: Spike Milligan, James Coburn and Professor Eric Laithwaite
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson in conversation with Spike Milligan, James Coburn and Professor Eric Laithwaite

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo is horrified by the prospect of dressing in saucy clothes for her music societys production of Sweet Charity, and Tom discovers oil in his garden. Classic comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Keith

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Hacker attempts to gain support for his tax cuts - by threatening to raise the duty on tobacco. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small

programme.title: A Slow Odyssey
programme.sub-title: A Slow Odyssey: A Turtles Journey
programme.desc: An immersive journey into the world of a green sea turtle, using only natural sounds and embedded graphics to deliver detailed information about its daily routine

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.sub-title: The Age of the Steam Locomotive
programme.desc: The revolution in transport brought about by steam power, charting the technologys development from the earliest colliery railways, through the first passenger train services and to the end of an era in the 1960s

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of the Northumberland village of Warkworth. With the help of locals he discovers clues that point back almost 1,000 years to the Norman conquest, revealing how the invaders laid the foundations of a planned community still visible to this day

programme.title: Inside Classical
programme.desc: Owain Wyn Evans presents as the BBC National Orchestra of Wales perform some spooky film favourites, including John Williams scores to Harry Potter, Jaws and E.T. Plus, some classical gothic music by Bach, Saint-Saëns and Korsakov

programme.title: Man Alive
programme.desc: Speaking to couples who have chosen not to take the traditional route towards marriage, some have been previously married and are unable to obtain the divorces they need while others see it as an outdated concept, to discover the effects on their children and how society views couples who are living in sin. First broadcast in 1966

programme.title: Man Alive
programme.desc: Reporter Gillian Strickland follows a typical office as they prepare for their annual party, the spree itself and the aftermath. First broadcast in 1970

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: JK Galbraith examines the First World War as an instrument in changing the old social order, and especially Lenin, who spent most of the war exiled in Switzerland urging soldiers to start a world revolution. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.sub-title: The Rise and Fall of Money
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith looks at the history of economic thinking and the problems in industrial society that are factors in it

programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs John Chantarasak, Thomasina Miers and Daisy Terry, and by special guests Bryan Cranston and Marianne Jean-Baptiste. Drinks expert Helen McGinn pairs the wines with the studio dishes

programme.title: Mary at 90: A Lifetime of Cooking
programme.desc: Mary Berry takes a fond look back at her career in food, while cooking some of her favourite dishes with friends both old and new. To begin with, she is joined by comedian Tom Allen. Together, they take a boat ride and cook dishes, including Marys classic pan-fried cod, her mothers bread and butter pudding and a Thai chicken traybake

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekends matches, including Tottenham Hotspur v Chelsea, Burnley v Arsenal and Liverpool v Aston Villa

programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Epsom in Surrey, and ails one of Londons hackney cabs to take him across the capital. Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe assist the teams

programme.title: Live International Rugby League
programme.desc: England v Australia (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the second fixture in the three-match Ashes series, which takes place at Hill Dickinson Stadium in Liverpool. This is the first time this stadium has hosted a rugby league contest and both teams will be eager to make an impact ahead of next weekends concluding game in Leeds

Each pair is randomly assigned a secret stash of cash, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present this years Halloween special, which sees the couples performing lots of tricks and treats to wow the judges and win viewers votes. Frightening foursome Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke will give their usual critiques before scoring the dancers efforts before the public vote opens

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the game show in which contestants answer questions with the aid of celebrity experts - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance. This weeks specialist knowledge comes from Josh Widdicombe, Chris Harris, Colin Jackson, Harriet Kelmsley, Shirley Ballas, Frankie Bridge, and Jordan North and William Hanson in the double chair

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: An explosive finale reveals the secrets of flight CBZ51 and the identity of the killer. Mystery, starring Eric McCormack

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Aston Villa at Anfield and Tottenham Hotspur v Chelsea at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. Champions Liverpool claimed a 2-0 home win over the Villans last term, while the Blues claimed a memorable 4-3 victory over Spurs in the corresponding fixture 11 months ago. Plus, Brighton and Hove Albion v Leeds United, Burnley v Arsenal, Crystal Palace v Brentford, Fulham v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Nottingham Forest v Manchester United

programme.desc: Kelly Somers talks to Everton and England goalkeeper Jordan Pickford

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Weather Watchers with Barra Best
programme.desc: The weather presenter and journalist examines how climate shapes everyones lives and looks at the activities that it enables people to participate in

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Mehreen Baig present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.desc: The musical Friday evening service from Nottingham Liberal Synagogue, which is part of the Progressive Judaism movement. The inclusive service, led by Rabbi Gili Zidkiyahu alongside co-Rabbi Josh Levy, welcomes all members of the community together to usher in the Sabbath

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Kings Lynn on the north Norfolk coast, with experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell assisting the teams. Charlie also visits the North Sea coast to discover how a devastating flood led to a safer Britain

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: On All Souls Day, the Rev Kate Bottley explores faith, grief and bereavement with Christians in the Midlands and visits a bereavement-friendly church

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Wildlife that live thousands of kilometres from land, featuring footage of baby turtles using debris as life rafts and whales sharks embarking on lengthy voyages across the Pacific to the point where it is safest to give birth. Special pressure-proof cameras are used to film sperm whales hunting for squid a kilometre beneath the surface and the impact of plastic pollution on the oceans is revealed

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: In Autumn, Hamza heads to the south Devon coast to spot Atlantic bluefin tuna, and pays a night-time visit to Londons Highgate Cemetery in search of urban foxes. He also explores a cave system in Northern Ireland, where experts have discovered a hidden species of cave spiders and a fungus that turns the underground arachnids into zombies

programme.title: Coco
programme.desc: A Mexican boy longs to be a guitarist, despite his family hating music. During the Day of the Dead festivities, he gets transported to the land of the dead, and with the help of a cunning skeleton, hopes to find his ancestor and learn the secrets of his familys history. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Anthony Gonzalez and Gael Garcia Bernal

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and John Craven explore Wiltshires woodlands, meeting the people who work to protect them, including foresters, conservationists, artists and ecologists, and going in search of one of Britains most elusive mammals - the dormouse. John meets volunteers working on the Kennet and Avon Canal, while Adam Henson takes part in an annual sheep drive in Bedfordshire

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin reveals hidden wildlife gems to be found in winter, travelling from the frozen Highlands of Scotland down to the quiet suburbs of Sussex. He goes in search of a bird that turns white to blend in with the snow and wild boars that have returned to Britains forests for the first time in 700 years, and climbs a three-metre-tall scaffold tower to get footage of wild tawny owls

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: The frights keep coming on Strictlys Halloween weekend as the couples find out the results. The professionals invite viewers to a Monsters Ball and theres music by Cat Burns. As the witching hour approaches, two more couples will be sent down into the dreaded dance off and for one, the die is cast. Who will be banished from the ballroom for good?

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.sub-title: Hill of Tarvit Mansion and Garden 2
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Hill of Tarvit Mansion and Garden, Fife. Finds include a futuristic chair that has appeared on several sci-fi TV series, an unusual solid silver table decoration from Australia, an embroidered map of the world, and a jug made by Picasso. Fiona is challenged to tell real gems from synthetic ones, and plays a round of hickory golf

programme.title: Riot Women
programme.desc: After six weeks at Beths house, a happy, healthy Kittys world shifts when she runs into her abusive ex-boyfriend and SpongeBob brings news of her elusive gangland father. Nisha is backed into a brutal corner at work, and instead of the bland pop song theyve practised, the Riot Women decide to sing a much more incendiary song, one that Beth and Kitty wrote last week

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, featuring West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium and Manchester City v Bournemouth at Etihad Stadium. Newcastle claimed a 1-0 win away to the Hammers last term, but the Londoners will hope to fare better under the stewardship of Nuno Espírito Santo. The Citizens prevailed 3-1 over Bournemouth in last seasons corresponding fixture, but the Cherries are enjoying an excellent campaign so far this time around

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekends matches in the Super League, including Chelsea v London City Lionesses and Brighton and Hove Albion v Manchester United

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by double Oscar nominee Keira Knightley, now turned childrens author with I Love You Just the Same. Plus, female education activist Malala Yousafzai talks about her new memoir Finding My Way, Aimee Lou Wood reflects on her role in BBC comedy series Daddy Issues and comedian Chris McCausland recounts his journey from comic to Strictly winner in Keep Laughing.Theres music from Mumford and Sons with Hozier, who perform their new single Rubber Band Man

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: It is Halloween in Bikini Bottom, and the Flying Dutchman is going to make sure everyone is scared - even SpongeBob

programme.title: Doctor Who Confidential
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the press tour that launched the series, which saw stars Matt Smith and Karen Gillan travel from Belfast to London, visiting their home towns of Northampton and Inverness en route. Designers also offer an insight into the creation of the underground city featured in the episode Cold Blood

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Doctor tries to persuade mankind and the reptilian Silurians to live in peace and share the Earth. However, the leader of the reptiles military is determined to wage war, while some of the humans plot a desperate reprisal of their own. Meera Syal, Neve McIntosh and Robert Pugh guest star alongside Matt Smith, Karen Gillan and Arthur Darvill

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pals return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessas shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma receives dodgy life advice from her incarcerated sister Catherine and Rita, her alcoholic boss. Worried that she will be having the baby alone, she enlists Cherry to help her find a suitable, ideally rich, father for her unborn child. Meanwhile, Malcolm thinks he has found love with a woman online. Gemma educates him on the perils of catfishing - but Derek encourages Malcolm to meet her. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey and Taj Atwal

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma attends birthing classes led by a very eccentric antenatal teacher. Realising she needs more support, she seeks advice from her aunt Jess, Malcolms sister. Malcolm and Gemma are invited to Jess and her domineering husband Tyrones new house for a party. Malcolm is scared of Tyrone, who intimidates him with his new hot tub. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey and Taj Atwal

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The pressure is on as the queens singing, dancing and acting skills are challenged in Peter Pansy - The Rusical. West End musical theatre legend Mazz Murray joins head judge RuPaul, alongside Michelle Visage and Graham Norton on the judging panel. Later, the curtain comes down on yet another queen

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Sarah Keyworth hosts, as second heat contenders Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh take to the stage of Birminghams Hockley Social Club in a bid to book their place in the final. Head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri is joined in her ranks by comedian, writer and podcaster Aurie Styla and local Brum stand-up Lindsey Santoro

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Alexandra Palace in north London, venue of the BBCs first ever television broadcast, stages the south of England heat, as comics Blank Peng, Fab Goualin, Sharifa Butterfly, Sydney May and Evaldas Karosas battle it out to book their place in this years grand final showdown. Host Sara Pascoe is joined by stand-up comics Catherine Bohart and Michael Odewale, who appear alongside Fatiha El-Ghorri on the panel of judges

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Jonny goes for an interview at the biscuit factory. Janet gets the chance to become a star, and Gaz confronts his fear of sheep head-on, while Louise tries desperately to hang on to Mick. Comedy, starring Ralf Little, Natalie Casey, Kathryn Drysdale and Sheridan Smith

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Janet is offered a job on a cruise ship but realises taking it will mean leaving Jonny and Corinthian behind. Louise learns the truth about her parents and Donna goes into business

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Donnas career falters just as Janets is taking off. Louise gets a letter from her mother but cant face reading it, and proud father Jonny leads the charge in the fight for baby-changing facilities in the pub

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Louise gets a shock when she meets her birth mother for the first time. Gaz decides he has to make a real commitment to Donna, and Janet talks dirty for a living. Starring Kathryn Drysdale and Will Mellor

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Brothers, flatmates and polar opposites Samir and Nikhil find themselves on an adventure when they accidentally steal a package from their maniac neighbour. Short, one-off comedy, starring Karan Gill, Ikky Kabir, Eshaan Akbar, Elina Saleh, Ed Kear and Andrea Valls

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma receives dodgy life advice from her incarcerated sister Catherine and Rita, her alcoholic boss. Worried that she will be having the baby alone, she enlists Cherry to help her find a suitable, ideally rich, father for her unborn child. Meanwhile, Malcolm thinks he has found love with a woman online. Gemma educates him on the perils of catfishing - but Derek encourages Malcolm to meet her. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey and Taj Atwal

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma attends birthing classes led by a very eccentric antenatal teacher. Realising she needs more support, she seeks advice from her aunt Jess, Malcolms sister. Malcolm and Gemma are invited to Jess and her domineering husband Tyrones new house for a party. Malcolm is scared of Tyrone, who intimidates him with his new hot tub. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey and Taj Atwal

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the locals prepare for quiz night at the Vic, Kat wrestles with a decision as a discovery weighs heavily on her. Julie helps George see a situation from a different perspective, and Ross confides in Alfie

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Quiz night in the Vic ends abruptly as everyone reels from Kats bombshell. When she realises Zoes actions are impacting her business and family, she gives her daughter an ultimatum. Meanwhile, Suki and Eve take a positive step, and Oscar turns detective

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Halloween is off to a bad start for Alfie when the burst sewer pipe leaks in the barrel store, but as he cleans up, Alfie discovers a VHS tape from 1980s. Meanwhile, Anthony steps in to defuse a situation, and Eve faces a new hurdle

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As Halloween night continues, Zoe grows increasingly paranoid that someone is out to get her and accuses Anthony before kicking him out of the Vic. And questions of the past come to the fore as Kat, Zoe and Tommy watch the video from 1988

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As morning breaks, breakfast proves to be a wake-up call for the faithful as the traitors strike again. Bridges need to be built if the celebrity players hope to add money to the prize fund, but with protection from murder on offer, some may be more interested in looking after number one. At the round table, suspicions continue to rise. Can the traitors deflect accusations, or will the faithful see through their lies? Presented by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the game nears the end, the murders become increasingly harder for the traitors. With time running out to increase the final prize pot, the celebrity players take on a mission where one mistake could cause heads to roll. At the round table, the faithful have one final chance to discover the identity of the banished player. Hosted by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined once again by series one Traitor Wilf and series three Traitor Minah, as well as the latest murdered and banished players. There is all the latest analysis, gossip and predictions from episode seven

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by series three winner Jake, and they are accompanied on the sofa by the latest banished and murdered players from the game

programme.title: The Woman in Black
programme.desc: A lawyer tormented by the death of his wife is sent to a remote village to put deceased client Alice Drablows affairs in order. The locals are suspicious of outsiders and determined to keep the areas tragic history a secret, and the late Mrs Drablows isolated house appears to be haunted by a vengeful spirit that seems hell-bent on redressing a decades-past grievance. Horror based on Susan Hills novel, with Daniel Radcliffe and Ciaran Hinds

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, the Ghost and the Gravestone
programme.desc: Radio presenter Sian Eleri investigates the paranormal activity at Penyffordd Farm in north Wales, the house being widely considered the most haunted house in Britain in the late 1990s. She begins by meeting with specialist psychologist Dr Daniels who was called in by the family living on the farm at the time when they became desperate for answers for the strange activity in their home. The doctor explains that of the many apparently paranormal cases of his career, this was the one that stayed with him and still perplexes him to this day

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. After a video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars

programme.title: Paranormal: Britains Last Witch
programme.desc: Sian Eleri recounts the story of Helen Duncan, who claimed she could summon the dead. Helen was a Scottish medium, who in 1944 went on trail at the Old Bailey and became the last person convicted and imprisoned under the Witchcraft Act. Sian visits Helens birthplace, Callander, a small town where her childhood premonitions caused fear in the community

programme.title: Paranormal: Britains Last Witch
programme.desc: Disturbed by a recording of what appears to be a spirit voice and accounts of the late medium Helen Duncan summoning physical spirit forms, Sian Eleri focuses on evidence from those who believe this apparent seance to be fake. Searching for answers and hoping to understand how Helen was convincing people they were communicating with their dead loved ones, Sian tracks down a modern-day medium. He claims to commune with the other side, but a seance in Edinburgh leaves Sian with more questions than she first started with

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Preoccupied with the ball game on TV, nobody pays much attention to Dianes sadness over the death of her family cat. It is left to Sam to discover the reason for Dianes grief. Meanwhile, Sam and Coach use insider information to make a bet

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Diane is aghast when Carla tricks the surprised but ecstatic Marshall Lipton into believing he is the father of her unborn child. Bar-room comedy, starring Rhea Perlman

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam supports his former baseball team-mate Tom when he comes out of the closet in his new autobiography, hosting the book promotion press event at the bar

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam and Diane challenge each other to find their perfect dates, but he ends up grabbing a highly unsuitable partner for her from the pool room who isnt quite what she had in mind. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Shelley Long

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert asks Ray and Debra to help with his criminal psychology course by taking IQ tests - but gives them misleading results to gauge their reactions

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra becomes jealous of a waitress who catches Rays eye. Although the situation is perfectly innocent, the couple soon blow everything out of all proportion

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank has some anecdotes published in a magazine, sowing the seeds of grand writing ambitions. He approaches Rays editor about becoming a columnist, but finds his way with words leaves a lot to be desired. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink is delighted when a station in another city begins relaying his radio show - until he struggles to compete with the popularity of the host he has replaced. Elsewhere, Niles, Daphne and Martins attempt to build a table does not go according to plan

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphnes birthday party sparks a series of unexpected events, and after a night of intimacy, Frasier pursues Roz to her family reunion in Wisconsin, where he pretends to be her estranged partner Roger. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Peri Gilpin

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles persuades Daphnes hard-drinking father to call on her mother in Seattle, hoping he can inspire them to start afresh. Meanwhile, Frasier and Roz reflect on their night together. Comedy, guest starring Brian Cox

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A spoof of TV thriller Homeland in which Homer returns from a nuclear convention a changed man. Lisas suspicions are aroused when she realises her dad has given up pork and beer and has developed a sudden fondness for power plant schematics, so she enlists the services of an unhinged FBI agent (voiced by Kristen Wiig, Bridesmaids) to get to the bottom of his behaviour

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The death of a popular Springfield man prompts four locals to address the biggest regrets of their lives so far. Homer still feels the sting of selling his Apple shares, wife Marge worries she may have been responsible for Barts bad-boy instincts and newsreader Kent Brockman reveals he chickened out of a career move. As for the fourth - it seems even Mr Burns liked someone

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at 38 St Giles in Norwich, where guests enjoy a historic afternoon at the citys cathedral, and breakfast is a roaring success for everyone but one

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Harry and Sarah hope to wow their guests with their recently renovated pub The Royal Oak in Hawkhurst, Kent. Unfortunately, the style doesnt match one BandBers standards. After an afternoon on the beers at a microbrewery, moods are high but some pernickety furniture feedback brings Harry and Sarah back down to earth with a bump

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandBers head to Tiddington in Oxfordshire for the weeks third visit, where Dawn hosts at her country pub, The Fox and Goat. The facilities seem to be flawless, leaving one guest determined to find some faulty furniture. Theres another historic afternoon out, this time with a tour around Blenheim Palace. All that walking should have the BandBers knackered and ready for bed - so why does one of them have such a restless night?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to No 64 at The Joiners in West Malling, Kent. Host Ollie hopes that his French-styled BandB will have that je-ne-sais-quoi to win the competition. The guests monkey around at a zoo in the afternoon before things get heated in the kitchen the next morning. The heat rises even further when Ollie sees his breakfast scores

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its payment day, and after an epic battle all week, the contenders meet up one final time to find out which boutique BandB has triumphed

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Swansea to help Sarah and Caradog, who moved into their four-bedroom home shortly before their third child was born in 2008 and have been struggling for space ever since, with only one bathroom, a cramped kitchen and an office squeezed into the box room. Sarah is ready to list it. But Caradog is determined to love it and is convinced this home can work with Kirsties magic touch. He also loves the garage and thinks itll be hard to beat elsewhere. With a long list of problems to solve and a budget of £75,000, Kirstie has a tricky task on her hands. But will a refurbished family heirloom swing it in her favour? Meanwhile, Phil hits the streets with a search budget of £500,000, looking for three fabulous houses to make Caradog question his allegiance to Team Love It

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Alison Hammond and Noel Fielding present as the semi-finalists take on patisserie week, serving up cream horns and tackling a recipe for a sugar glass dome in the technical round. In the showstopper, they produce a macaron sculpture that depicts something meaningful to them, before judges Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood decide who will be going through to the final

programme.title: Horse of the Year Show 2025
programme.desc: Matt Baker, Gemma Owen and para-dressage rider Tegan Vincent-Cooke present Coverage of the equestrian event, featuring behind-the-scenes stories from the UKs equine world. Featuring in-hand classes and high-stakes showjumping with riders and ponies from all over the country

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Bettany Hughes Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany explores how communities have connected and thrived for millennia in Switzerland. She begins at the Jungfraujoch, stepping onto the Aletsch Glacier and meeting the custodians of its high-altitude research station. At the Great Saint Bernard Pass, she meets the priests of the hospice and explores their extraordinary archive. Alpine traditions are also examined, from William Tells legend to cheese-making in Gstaad. Finally, in the medieval heart of Bern, she climbs the cathedral and explores the 500-year-old Zytglogge clock

programme.title: Great British Train Journeys from Above
programme.desc: Hugh Bonneville narrates a journey through the rolling hills of Englands south-west on the West Somerset Railway created by Isambard Kingdom Brunel. Widely recognised as one of the greatest engineers of all time, Brunels remarkable railways and structures are known worldwide. This episode travels along his railway through the Quantock Hills to the Bristol Channel

programme.title: Honest Thief
programme.desc: A bank robber falls in love, and decides the time has come to bring his life of crime to an end. He turns himself in to the FBI, only to be double-crossed by two crooked agents. Crime thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Kate Walsh and Jai Courtney

programme.title: Trainspotting
programme.desc: A heroin addict makes a series of attempts to kick the habit, but the grind of everyday life and a circle of similarly self-destructive friends keep dragging him back to his old ways. Following a near-fatal overdose, he comes to the realisation that the only way to put his life in order is to rid himself of his friends - which is easier said than done. Danny Boyles drama based on Irvine Welshs novel, starring Ewan McGregor, Robert Carlyle and Ewen Bremner

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called out to a woman who got tangled up in her dogs leads, leaving her lapsing in and out of consciousness on her 45th wedding anniversary. Meanwhile, a man is in severe pain with an umbilical hernia and a woman has a suspected seizure at work. The paramedics also attend a baby thats just been born, with the mother having to deliver her baby on the bathroom floor

programme.title: Ramsays Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay heads to Harpers Ferry in West Virginia, where he tries to save the Towns Inn, a historic hotel run by retired teacher and junk hoarder Karan Townsend. She has accumulated so many useless belongings that there is hardly any room to accommodate guests. Can Gordon convince her to get rid of her clutter or will the hotel continue to go down the pan?

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Fife in Scotland to fix up a 1993 Toyota Supra MK4, owned by former competitive motorcycle racer Lisa, who, after a road accident, is no longer able to ride her beloved bikes. Her ongoing mobility problems have meant that the car has ended up in need of TLC. Lisas friends and family hope a fully restored car will lift her spirits

programme.title: Jamies One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver offers a solutions-based guide to make brilliantly easy and delicious meals all cooked in one pan, pot or dish. Jamie cooks a traybaked salmon in a bag, tomato fritters that can be prepared in a frying pan, and roasted rolled pork with a risotto that are both cooked in the same casserole pan

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It

Kirstie Allsopp embarked on a loft conversion - claiming its the best she has ever done - while Phil pulled some cracking rural properties out of the bag. But after making their decision, what was next for the couple?

programme.desc: With the BBC series having passed its 20th anniversary, this documentary recognises its many highs, its occasional lows, the costumes, the competition - and the controversies. The history of Strictly is charted amid insider secrets from the judges, professional dancers and celebrity contestant. Plus, the best and worst competitors are remembered and the pioneering ground the show has broken by championing those with disabilities and leading the way on same-sex dancing pairings recognised

programme.desc: National and international news

programme.title: Tommy Cooper: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: Performances by the comedian and magician and actor previously unseen by a British TV audience, including a guest appearance on The David Frost Show in New York in 1969, and his tour-de-force routine on an American TV special in 1967. The programme includes testimonies and memories from those who worked with or knew him, including actress Sheila Hancock, music producer Trevor Horn, broadcaster Janet Street-Porter, entertainer Jimmy Tarbuck and writer Colin Edmonds

programme.title: Andrew vs The Public: The Battle for Royal Lodge

programme.title: The Meghan Effect: How She Shook Up the Royal Family

programme.title: 70s TV We Loved and Lost

Putting away their mobiles and picking up their cuppas, the families are treated to a range of 50-year-old programmes including sitcoms, game shows, drama and news, as well as a range of 1970s adverts giving a glimpse of newly emerging brands and how they spoke to peoples aspirations and daily lives

programme.title: Are You Being Served?: Secrets and Scandals

programme.desc: Xand Van Tulleken and historian Tracy Borman examine the plot to kill James I by blowing up the House of Lords when the king would be present for the State Opening of Parliament. They follow Robert Catesby and his co-conspirators as they assemble their gang to carry out the attack, revealing just how dangerous it was to smuggle two and a half tons of gunpowder beneath the House of Lords, and show how the assassination of so many people in Parliament was meant to be the beginning of an audacious coup to take over the country

He insists the mutt must go to a new home, but when it is kidnapped by a crooked vet, dad has a change of heart and races to the rescue. Comedy, starring Charles Grodin, Bonnie Hunt, Oliver Platt and David Duchovny

programme.title: Michael McIntyres Big Show
programme.desc: The comedian returns with the third series of his family entertainment show, recorded in front of a live audience at Londons Theatre Royal on Drury Lane. He begins proceedings this time around with music by chart-topping Scottish singer-songwriter Emeli Sande, and a stand-up set by Joe Lycett, before returning to the stage to deliver some of his own new material. Former Labour Party politician Ed Balls plays Celebrity Send to All, and Michael gives one unsuspecting member of the public their 15 minutes of fame in Unexpected Star of the Show

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The Devil decides to put off retirement for a little longer, but his two oldest sons are left fuming - and decide to get revenge by creating Hell on Earth. Comedy, starring Adam Sandler, Patricia Arquette, Harvey Keitel, Rhys Ifans, Reese Witherspoon and Rodney Dangerfield

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son Barney arrive in Texas, where they enjoy driving around in tanks, experience space travel in a centrifuge and hear campfire tales about UFOs. First up, the pair undertake some centrifuge training, which is used to prepare astronauts for the crushing gravitational forces produced at take-off from the extreme exhilaration. They also head to the outskirts of Houston to meet some UFO enthusiasts who investigate claimed sightings of extra-terrestrials, and are gripped by stories of spaceships blocking roads and people being taken by aliens for experiments

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son Barney embark on the final leg of their journey, which sees the pair arrive in the Louisiana city of New Orleans. Here, they visit a spiritual voodoo priest for a spot of energy cleansing, and feed alligators in the Bayou with Captain Billy, who knows every corner of the wetlands, having been born and raised on the bayous of South Louisiana. Later, Bradley hops on board the Natchez jazz Steamboat, before the pair take to the streets to lead a spectacular parade with a six-piece band

programme.desc: Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop, while Raj sells out Leonard and Howard after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: On a weekend cabin trip with Penny and Amy, Sheldon spills one of Leonards secrets, while Howard and Bernadette must draw a line when Raj goes overboard with pregnancy gifts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon disagree over whether to continue holding their regular Roommate Agreement meetings, with Leonard suggesting they are no longer required, while Sheldon believes they are still essential. As the pairs squabble quickly escalates into a full-blown argument, the rest of their friends turn up for a planned Game of Thrones viewing party, and end up taking sides in the dispute - resulting in two warring factions taking up residence in 4A and 4B. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang goes to a bar and runs into Pennys old boyfriend Zack, while Bernadette is left to spend the evening with Sheldon when she cannot go wine tasting with the others. Elsewhere, things do not go to plan when Raj introduces his new girlfriend, Claire. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon discovers a surprise screening of The Avengers is scheduled at a local cinema, complete with a QandA session with the films director, Joss Whedon. However, the event just happens to clash with time hed planned to spend with Amy, so he decides to pay Stuart to be his subtitute for the afternoon while he and the other boys immerse themselves in Marvel superheroics. Meanwhile, Leonards mother Beverly arrives in town for an extended visit, and Penny takes the opportunity to bond with her new mother-in-law - and to make up for not inviting her to the wedding. Comedy, guest starring Christine Baranski

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Conflict arises when Leonards newly divorced parents and Sheldons devoutly religious mother are all in town at the same time. And when Howard and Raj are contacted about the guidance system theyve developed, they assume that the government is out to get them. Laurie Metcalf, Christine Baranski and Judd Hirsch guest star

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr, and Q head to Miami to play pranks on the beach, and they also zip around on scooters controlled by the others

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr, and Q teach fencing, pose as hairstylists, while the punished joker melts down during a presentation on climate change

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr, and Q host a team-building seminar and pose as caricature artists on a boardwalk. Plus, the loser faces a confused and unamused biker gang

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr, and Q hit the supermarket to confuse shoppers in an epic game of hide-and-sneak, and the guys draw straws at a barbecue joint

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily and Marshall throw a housewarming party but things get off to a bad start when Ted nearly comes to blows with Marshalls boss, Barney chats up a crazy divorcee, and Mickeys basement honey business gets out of control. Comedy, starring Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The friends set out to break up Barney and Quinns relationship when Ted reveals she is a stripper, but the duo teach them all a lesson. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily tell embarrassing sex stories, while Ted and Robin are finally reconciled

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry and Adam join forces to save a local water park that is being threatened with closure, while the planning of the wedding opens a rift between Beverly and Erica

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam films his high-schools final football game of the year, but misses the winning touchdown. Beverly discovers her neighbour is moving and is determined to buy his home.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barrys case of poison ivy causes problems for Erica and Geoff, while having Mr Glascott living next door presents a challenge for the family

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for the Great Albino Pumpkin
programme.desc: Adam finds himself disenchanted with Halloween, while Barry decides to bring his old rapper alter ego Big Tasty back to life. Barry and Joanne meet Elvira, Mistress of the Dark

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly encourages Principal Ball to establish a non-athlete senior night, while Ericas friends are not interested in being pre-wedding fun captain so she asks Geoffs sister

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly learns Linda Schwartz is hosting Thanksgiving and is concerned that her role is being threatened, while Pop-Pop surprises the family by showing up with a new lady friend

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples compete in south-east London, where the rivals are all planning to serve lamb. Other highlights include wedding bells and a musical turn from one of the hosts

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Brighton, three couples compete to host the best dinner party and secure a cash prize of £1,000. First up, shipping broker Dan and his partner of 16 years, Pippa, hope that a menu of family favourites will bag them the cash - if Dan does exactly what Pippa tells him to. When glamorous duo Shan and Lauren turn up, Pippa witnesses the beginnings of a beautiful bromance between the men. Romance is in no short supply with the final couple, South Africans Jared and Ian. These lovebirds enjoy nothing better than giving each other `zerbits" and are more than happy to oblige with a demonstration on their night

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Manchester, three rival couples compete to host the best dinner party and win £1,000. Michelle and Laura kick off the competition with a hearty yet elegant menu. On day two Rob and Emma up the ante with locally sourced produce thats `proper" dinner party food, before Lorenzo and Katie put on generous Italian feast for the final night

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eaterys co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Boston to help change the fortunes of a failing Italian restaurant run by two brothers. The eaterys decline began when one of the pair started embezzling money to fund his prescription drug addiction, and things only got worse when the he was sentenced to four years in prison. With the time now served, he has returned, but must first regain his brothers trust before he can save their business

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Bridgeport, Connecticut, to visit Cafe Tavolini, which is being neglected by husband and wife managers teetering on the edge of divorce. The estranged couples two children are struggling to save the business from their parents disputes, and the visiting chef tries to shock the pair into stopping the restaurant from becoming a casualty of their quarrel

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zekes, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In Cedar Creek, a small, rural town in Texas, Gordon tries to help the owners of Leos Italian Grill rediscover their dream of a vibrant restaurant. After his son died, Leos passion faded, leading to poor food quality and service. Gordon sets out to re-ignite and partner Michelles love for the business and restore the restaurant to its former glory

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: No-naughty-bits version. Little Alex Horne has a lot of fun administering a task involving ducks and mystery. But while that may be his favourite sort of task, its not appreciated by everyone, especially Sanjeev Bhaskar. Ania Magliano makes a noise like a small cat, Maisie Adam becomes smug and Reece Shearsmith balances on one leg for an impressive length of time, while Phil Ellis struggles to open a door. Greg Davies uses all his skills to judge a series of pictures of animals on top of animals

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.sub-title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown: Best Bits
programme.desc: Host Jimmy Carr and regular contributor Jon Richardson are joined by a host of top comedians for a compilation of best bits from the show, including Lee Mack, Sarah Millican, Alan Carr, Richard Ayoade, Katherine Ryan, Tom Allen, Judi Love, Nick Mohammed, Jonathan Ross, Rose Matafeo and Sam Campbell, along with regulars Joe Wilkinson, Susie Dent and Rachel Riley

programme.title: Greg Davies: Firing Cheeseballs at a Dog
programme.desc: Comedian Greg Daviess hugely successful and acclaimed debut stand-up show from 2011, in which he sets out to chronicle the significant issues surrounding modern life in his own irreverent style. A hit at the Edinburgh Festival, it was nominated for the Edinburgh Comedy Award before going on a sell-out, UK-wide tour

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Teams captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by guests Louie Spence, Joe Wilkinson, Elis James and Shappi Khorsandi, who answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today. Irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys work on the tills at a burger restaurant before taking their fun to a department store. Later, the loser faces his fears in a terrifying elevator ride

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys try to humiliate one another at a convenience store before visiting a wedding expo. Later, the loser must face his childhood crush

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys are less than silent in a library, and hunt for their imaginary wives again at the mall, while two of them dress up as ice-hockey goaltenders and block shots from former New Jersey Devils players

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys hit the ice rink to play a slippery balloon game and try to get support for ridiculous causes at the park

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The pranksters gatecrash a gallery opening, where their antics are not appreciated, and also pass bizarre judgment on unsuspecting grocery shoppers

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys freeze out skaters at an ice rinks rental counter and then head to a mall, where they have the audacity to ask strangers to mind their manners

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for the Great Albino Pumpkin
programme.desc: Adam finds himself disenchanted with Halloween, while Barry decides to bring his old rapper alter ego Big Tasty back to life. Barry and Joanne meet Elvira, Mistress of the Dark

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly encourages Principal Ball to establish a non-athlete senior night, while Ericas friends are not interested in being pre-wedding fun captain so she asks Geoffs sister

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly learns Linda Schwartz is hosting Thanksgiving and is concerned that her role is being threatened, while Pop-Pop surprises the family by showing up with a new lady friend

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam learns that he has been accepted into NYU, but his excitement is soon diminished when he realises Brea has been accepted into a school far away and fears the distance will affect their relationship

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: You Only Die Once, or Twice, but Never Three Times
programme.desc: Beverly creates a plan to save Formica Mikes marriage, and Barry enlists Adam and his friends to create a James Bond-themed home movie in his ongoing efforts to court Joanne

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Sam Prince is seeing Beks in a whole new light, and the pair get cosy in the Cotswolds on a group getaway to Ollys family estate. Sam Vanderpump and Alice are looking forward to parenthood, but their joy is rocked by life-changing news for the soon-to-be father. Jack is still down about breaking up with Livvy, so his friends decide that enough is enough and try find a way to put a smile on his face

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to Charlies Italian bistro in La Verne, southern California, where the owners lack of business nous is putting her relatives homes at risk, after her mother and sister put them up as collateral. To make matters worse, the restaurants food is less than appetising and its long-serving chef seems to be incompetent

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Baltimore, Maryland, where Denise Whiting has alienated customers by trademarking the word hon, a term of endearment used by the local community. When she opened Cafe Hon in 1992 it was a roaring success, but as a result of Denises unwavering business ambition, people started to boycott the restaurant, leaving her frustrated by falling sales

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes concerned that his comfortable lifestyle is having an impact on his professional progress and is stopping him from achieving scientific greatness, so he asks the gang to make life more difficult for him. Meanwhile, Howard invents an unflattering game about Raj. Starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon are forced to defend themselves against criticism from an online bully after publishing a physics paper. Meanwhile, the girls confront embarrassing moments from their pasts during a night in. Comedy, guest starring Stephen Hawking, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard receives shocking news as everyone prepares for the re-opening of the comic-book store. Penny tries to teach Sheldon how to let it go, but she is unable to follow her own advice when she learns something infuriating about Amy. Comedy, guest starring Nathan Fillion, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic, a blue hedgehog who can run at supersonic speeds, is transported to Earth. A decade later, while enjoying life in Montana, his speedy skills create an electromagnetic pulse. Scientific genius Dr Robotnik is hired to investigate, and becomes obsessed with capturing the creature for his power. Live-action fantasy adventure based on the video games, starring James Marsden and Jim Carrey, with the voice of Ben Schwartz

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great New Years Bake Off 2022
programme.desc: Noel Fielding, Matt Lucas, Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood invite four former contestants to return to the tent in the hope of being crowned the first Star Baker of 2023. The hopefuls are 2021 finalist Chigs, 2020s Lottie and Manon and Antony from 2018. To help see in the new year, the bakers, family and friends are entertained by the cast of Riverdance

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny agree to participate in an unusual experiment, and Leonard, Amy, Raj and Emily spend the evening trying to escape from a zombie. Elsewhere, Howard and Bernadette run into trouble at the airport after returning from Mrs Wolowitzs funeral. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Trouble arises when Amy learns that Sheldon has applied for a one-way mission to colonise Mars. Meanwhile, Leonard surprises Penny with a gift, and Raj decides to snoop around Emilys flat after she is called back to work during their evening together. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is upset when a magazine fails to mention him in an article about the paper he co-wrote with Sheldon. Meanwhile, a power cut at Mrs Wolowitzs home leads to a final family dinner in her honour. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Leonard and Sheldon are invited to speak at UC Berkeley, they decide to take a detour and try to meet one of their idols - Star Wars director George Lucas. Meanwhile, Raj and Amy offer to settle a dispute with a game of table tennis. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard finds out that he has a half-brother, Sheldon and Amy have a platonic sleepover, and Penny gets an offer to audition for a Kevin Smith film. American comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart is awarded a driving licence for saving Springfield from a fire, and finds himself tied down when he develops a serious relationship with a teenage girl in a nearby town. Meanwhile, Lisa lands herself in trouble by falsely claiming Native American heritage. With the voice of Natalie Portman

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A documentary film-maker visits Springfield to see how the towns residents are progressing, making Homer worry he will not be seen as a success. In an attempt to convince the director of his so-called achievements, he borrows Mr Burns summer mansion, but his cunning plan does not have the desired effect. With the voice of Eric Idle

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart is referred to a therapist who is affected so deeply by the experience that she too is soon in need of treatment. Lisa gets a job tutoring Cletuss hillbilly children - and accidentally turns them into famous singers managed by Krusty and composer Stephen Sondheim. With the guest voices of Sondheim, Meg Ryan and Peter Bogdanovich

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer accidentally declares himself bankrupt, while Bart and Lisa con a delivery man into giving them a large amount of cardboard boxes. Grampa leaves the Springfield Retirement Castle and ends up falling in love with Selma

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes a member of the paparazzi, and proves so successful at snapping embarrassing photographs that his celebrity victims seek revenge on him for exposing their indiscretions

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Famous faces including Nick Grimshaw, Rylan, Roman Kemp, Clare Balding, Gyles Brandreth, Carol Vorderman, Emma and Matt Willis, Andi Oliver, Oti Mabuse, Bill Bailey, Rob Beckett, Tom Allen, Fearne Cotton and Gok Wan review shows from July 2022, including Stranger Things, Love Island, Paul Hollywood Eats Mexico, How to Build a Sex Room, Long Lost Family, Countdown and BBC News coverage of Boris Johnsons resignation as PM

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Great Celebrity Bake Off for SU2C, Hunted, One Day, Anton and Giovannis Adventures in Spain, Married at First Sight Australia, Chicken Nugget, This Morning and BBC News

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Apprentice, Hunted, Coronation Street, The Underdog: Josh Must Win, Anton and Giovannis Adventures in Spain and Bridge of Lies. Plus, they reflect on news coverage of the Princess of Wales cancer diagnosis

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Annie, 37, has not had a relationship in a long time and is a bag of nerves as she waits to have dinner with builder Barry, who is three years her senior. However, she is also is struggling with a bigger issue and worries its a deal-breaker. Kevin, 67, is in the drainage business and brings his unique blend of diamond in the rough and Essex boy charm to his date with receptionist Meguel

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Savile Row tailor Riki has returned to the dating game after losing a lot of weight, but still struggles to see why women would find him attractive. Visual merchandiser Queenie admires Rikis penchant for a natty hat, but when he cant stop referring to himself as the beast, he risks losing her. Will and Des initially seem like a match made in heaven, but their date soon becomes one of the biggest car-crash encounters the restaurant has ever seen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is asked to create a message on the off-chance a Nasa mission discovers alien life, and the guys fight over what he should do. Penny contemplates a return to acting. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard questions his engineering abilities when he and Sheldon cant get a toy drone to fly. A cancelled flight almost stops Leonard from giving the commencement address at his former high school, while Raj pits his parents against each other when his father cuts him off financially

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsays next stop is Philadelphia, where family run restaurant Chiarellas is struggling to survive in an area full of thriving Italian eateries. Tommy and Dina Definos marriage is on the verge of collapse and his sense of personal failure only adds to the troubles of their crisis-ridden business

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.sub-title: Spanish Pavillion, Kingston Cafe, La Frite and Capri
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fell by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: As the village reels from an explosive week, residents face emotional fallout - with hearts broken, loyalties tested and unlikely alliances formed. With the truth finally out, and his past caught up to him, Donnys consumed by guilt and plans to flee Hollyoaks. Meanwhile, the teens return to the village, but worries and hidden secrets cause tensions. Billy Corkhill discovers that Hollyoaks has more in common with Brookside Close than he thought. As the hospital faces an intruder alert, heartbreak follows in the mortuary - and a residents confession takes a shocking turn

programme.title: Hollyoaks Unwrapped
programme.desc: Actor Kieron Richardson gives viewers a behind-the-scenes look at the soap, with guests Nadine Mulkerrin, Anna Passey and Anya Lawrence

programme.title: Celebrity Come Dine with Me
programme.sub-title: Hollyoaks Does Come Dine With Me
programme.desc: To celebrate 30 years of the soap, Hollyoaks stars Isabelle Smith, Anya Lawrence, Charlie Wernham, James Redmond and Nicole Barber-Lane take it in turns to throw a dinner party. The first host, McQueen matriarch Nicole, is hoping that her tropical-themed evening will transport her guests to paradise. Izzy discovers Nicoles didgeridoo, while Anya reveals the pitfalls of kissing her on-screen co-stars

programme.title: Celebrity Come Dine with Me
programme.sub-title: Hollyoaks Does Come Dine With Me
programme.desc: The second host, Isabelle Smith, is hoping that her guests go crazy for her Mad Hatters Tea Party, despite her limited culinary skills

programme.title: Celebrity Come Dine with Me
programme.sub-title: Hollyoaks Does Come Dine With Me
programme.desc: James Redmond, who played Rory Finn Finnigan, hosts. This isnt his first turn on Come Dine with Me, and hes looking for redemption after previously finishing in last place

programme.title: Celebrity Come Dine with Me
programme.sub-title: Hollyoaks Does Come Dine With Me
programme.desc: On night four, Anya Lawrence, who plays Vicky Grant, hosts with a Greek theme. However, the main course proves controversial for one of the guests

programme.title: Celebrity Come Dine with Me
programme.sub-title: Hollyoaks Does Come Dine With Me
programme.desc: The final host, Charlie Wernham, throws an East End-themed night, on the set of Hollyoaks, and pushes the boat out with fresh seafood that has come all the way from Billingsgate Market in London

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Alison Hammond and Noel Fielding present as the semi-finalists take on patisserie week, serving up cream horns and tackling a recipe for a sugar glass dome in the technical round. In the showstopper, they produce a macaron sculpture that depicts something meaningful to them, before judges Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood decide who will be going through to the final

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: An unexpected arrival at the countryside retreat leads to a showdown. Also, as one marital breakdown continues to spiral, the group are caught in the crossfire at an explosive dinner party

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The group return from the retreat and head straight to the sofa for the latest Commitment Ceremony. Some couples reap the rewards from their time away, but for others turmoil continues to grow. Departures loom, and one emotional bride questions whether her marriage is beyond repair

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: While absence makes one grooms heart grow especially fonder, time apart reveals troubling fault lines in other marriages, testing one couples relationship to the brink of destruction

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The couples gather for their sixth dinner party, and while one groom cant wait to share his romantic realisation, others have less cause to celebrate

programme.title: Spies in Disguise
programme.desc: A secret agent branded a traitor tries to clear his name, with the aid of a socially awkward inventor he had fired for only developing non-lethal gadgets. The scientists latest invention gets out of control and transforms the spy into a pigeon - giving him the perfect disguise to prove his innocence. Animated adventure, with the voices of Will Smith, Tom Holland and Karen Gillan

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Noel Fielding and Alison Hammond host as soap stars past and present Chris Bisson, Natalie Cassidy, Dean Gaffney, Shobna Gulati and Sheree Murphy put their own spin on a traditional yule log, test their meringue skills and create their favourite storyline in biscuit form. Judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith decide which one will be crowned Festive Star Baker

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The proud residents of Springfield are outraged when they learn their town anthem was stolen from a travelling musician, so Bart and Lisa volunteer to find a replacement song. Meanwhile, Homer is on a mission to find a fat peoples rights group after a humiliating incident in which he gets stuck in his seat. With the guest voice of Pharrell Williams

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge becomes fed up of ferrying her kids around free of charge, so she joins the ranks of an online taxi service. Homer, meanwhile, inadvertently causes Moe to become bankrupt, so to help his friend out he gets another job as caretaker at the power plant

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Homestays get underway, giving the couples a glimpse of what life could be like outside of the experiment, and the opportunity to gain insight from loved ones. Also, a scandalous secret is revealed, threatening to blow another marriage apart

programme.desc: Lucindas joined by comedian Russell Kane to debrief after a week of partner swaps, homestays and belly dancing. Fresh off the back of a huge revelation, bride Nelly talks about her rollercoaster marriage, from the high of her wedding day to the moment when everything changed

programme.desc: A marine biologist and a deep-sea diver explore Chuuk Lagoon, one of the worlds greatest underwater graveyards, for a wreck discovered by sonar nearly 20 years ago

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson discovers more about the quiet village of Ravenglass in the Lake Districts National Park, which played a strategic role in the Roman empire. With the help of the Pennington family, whose ancestral home is Muncaster Castle, Ben is shown their latest Roman find, a unique stone slab with a Latin inscription thats been attributed to a Roman naval unit, Aelia Classica

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall: Unpacked
programme.desc: A look at some of the moments that nearly stopped the Expedition teams in their tracks, as well as the points where taking one step further meant no chance of turning back

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall: Unpacked
programme.desc: Steve and the crew encounter creatures both awe-inspiring and fear-inducing, including the worlds largest land predator. Plus, close encounters with nature itself in flooded caves of Mexico and on sheer cliffs of Oman

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall: Unpacked
programme.desc: The story of the world-class teams behind five expeditions. From the remote Arctic wilderness to flooded caves of Mexico their expertise are key

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: Scientists and wildlife film-makers led by Steve Backshall, George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan explore Mount Bosavi, a giant extinct volcano covered by thick and largely unexplored rainforest in New Guinea. With the help of trackers from a remote tribe, they search for rare creatures and species to find evidence that may help stop the areas trees being felled for timber. The nest of the worlds smallest parrot, an unusual beetle and new types of frog, gecko and bat are among the teams first discoveries
