programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos rail voyage continues through Connecticut heading north through the scenic New England states. In New Haven, a crash course in rowing takes place on a stretch of water where college teams from Yale and Harvard have battled for victory since 1852. Making tracks north to Vermont, Michael experiences 19th-century rural farm life, when its green pastures made it the butter capital of the world

programme.title: Dr Who and the Daleks
programme.desc: The eccentric time-traveller journeys to the Daleks home world, which has been devastated by their nuclear weapons. He enters their city and finds them engaged in a plot to exterminate their peaceful humanoid enemies the Thals. Sci-fi adventure based on the TV series, starring Peter Cushing, Roy Castle, Jennie Linden and Roberta Tovey

programme.title: Playing with Fire
programme.desc: A straight-laced fire superintendent and his elite team of expert firefighters come to the rescue of three siblings in the path of an encroaching wildfire, but quickly realise that no amount of training could prepare them for their most challenging job yet - as their babysitters. Comedy, starring John Cena, Keegan-Michael Key and John Leguizamo

programme.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
programme.desc: After being bitten by a radioactive arachnid, student Miles Morales develops incredible abilities, and becomes a version of Spider-Man. When a super collider device opens a gateway to other dimensions, Miles crosses paths with five counterparts to stop a threat for all realities. Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Shameik Moore and Nicolas Cage

programme.title: Jerry and Marge Go Large
programme.desc: A couple discover a mathematical loophole in the Massachusetts lottery and win millions to revive and rejuvenate their small town. Comedy drama based on a true story, starring Bryan Cranston, Annette Bening, Rainn Wilson and Larry Wilmore

programme.title: GI Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc: When a powerful experimental weapon is snatched by a mysterious terrorist organisation, two of the soldiers guarding it are recruited into a top-secret military strike force. As they go in search of the stolen technology, they uncover a plot by its creator to take over the world. Action adventure, with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: M3gan
programme.desc: Gemma, a toy company robotics engineer, applies for temporary protective custody of her nine-year-old niece, Cady, after her parents are killed. A hi-tech doll called M3GAN, which has malfunctioned in development, becomes Cadys unusual guardian, but the flaky android soon causes mayhem. Horror, starring Allison Williams, Violet McGraw and Ronny Chieng

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: Struggling to cope with his alter ego Venom, Eddie Brock attempts to re-ignite his journalistic career by interviewing serial killer Cletus Kasady. However, Kasady becomes the host of the symbiote Carnage and escapes prison after a failed execution. Comic-book fantasy sequel, directed by Andy Serkis and starring Tom Hardy, Woody Harrelson and Michelle Williams

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: Massachusetts doctor Louis Creed moves to a small Maine town with his wife Rachel, their kids, Ellie and Gage, and Church, the cat. While exploring the local woods, Ellie stumbles across a funeral procession of children taking a dead dog to a cemetery. Neighbour Jud Crandall warns the Creeds that the woods are dangerous, as they soon discover for themselves via the dark power of the local burial ground. Horror based on the Stephen King novel, starring Jason Clarke, Amy Seimetz and John Lithgow

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: A woman raises her six-year-old daughter to believe that Santa Claus does not exist, but they both have a change of heart after meeting a department store Father Christmas who claims to be the man himself. When the kindly fellow is accused of being a charlatan, his new friends engage a lawyer to prove his true identity. Remake of the 1947 family drama, with Richard Attenborough, Elizabeth Perkins, Mara Wilson and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: A wandering swordsman is knighted for his fighting prowess at the court of King Arthur and his wife, Lady Guinevere. However, the new knight and the queen develop a dangerous and secret attraction for each other, while a neighbouring warlord threatens the downfall of the kingdom. Adventure, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery, Julia Ormond and Ben Cross

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox

programme.title: One Day
programme.desc: A principled working-class woman and a selfish wealthy man meet the day they graduate from university, beginning a friendship that becomes a pivotal part of their lives. The changes they go through over the next 20 years are shown through the anniversaries of the day they first met. Romantic drama based on David Nicholls book, with Anne Hathaway and Jim Sturgess

programme.title: Deadpool 2
programme.desc: The wisecracking anti-hero meets Russell, a gifted youngster living in an orphanage but being pursued by a heavily armed cyborg from the future known as Cable. The mercenary soon joins forces with Bedlam, Shatterstar, Domino and other powerful mutants to protect young Russell from villainous Cable and his advanced weaponry. Futuristic action comedy, co-written, co-produced by and starring Ryan Reynolds, with Josh Brolin, Julian Dennison and Zazie Beetz

programme.title: Good Boys
programme.desc: Three lads skip school and embark on an epic journey while carrying stolen drugs. They are hunted by teenage girls, and attempt to make their way home in time for a long-awaited party. Director Gene Stupnitskys comedy, starring Jacob Tremblay, Keith L Williams and Brady Noon

programme.title: Moneyboys
programme.desc: A male sex worker - or moneyboy - must juggle the demands of his family, while keeping how he supports them a secret. Writer/director CB Yis drama, starring Kai Ko and Chloe Maayan. In Mandarin, with English subtitles

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: A disgraced lawman forced to live in exile in Mexico receives word that his brother has been murdered. He risks returning over the border into Texas to seek revenge, evading bounty hunters along the way. He discovers a corrupt politician was behind the killing and plans to expose his crimes. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Broderick Crawford

Western, starring Joan Crawford, Mercedes McCambridge, Sterling Hayden and Ernest Borgnine

programme.title: The Comancheros
programme.desc: A hard-bitten Texas Ranger joins forces with a convict and a gambler in a covert operation to run a gang of gunmen out of the territory for supplying Comanche warriors with arms and alcohol from a secret hideout in Mexico. After infiltrating the renegades secret camp, the heroes have to figure out how to survive until help arrives. Western, with John Wayne, Stuart Whitman, Ina Balin, Nehemiah Persoff and Lee Marvin

Western, starring John Wayne, Geraldine Page, Ward Bond and Michael Pate

Historical drama, starring Richard Egan, Ralph Richardson and Diane Baker

programme.desc: Danny and Brett help a woman in distress, but their efforts lead to them being accused of abduction. Drama, starring Tony Curtis and Roger Moore

Disaster movie, starring Mark Lutz, Anna Van Hooft and Emilie Ullerup

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh returns a wanted man to an army camp, but the commanding officer refuses to hand over his reward. Classic Western drama, starring Steve McQueen as a bounty hunter

programme.title: Waterloo
programme.desc: Napoleon returns from exile on Elba and regains control of the French army in a bid to reclaim his empire and depose the king. Meanwhile, the Duke of Wellington marshals the allied forces for the fateful battle to come and the day that will change the course of history. Drama, with Rod Steiger, Christopher Plummer, Orson Welles, Jack Hawkins, Dan OHerlihy, Michael Wilding and Virginia McKenna

programme.title: Away All Boats
programme.desc: A Merchant Navy captain accepts a demotion so he can serve in the Second World War, and ends up a lieutenant on board a transport ship. The harsh methods employed by the captain to whip his crew into shape lead to tension between them, which gives way to mutual respect as they fight through the dangers of the Pacific campaign. Drama, starring Jeff Chandler and George Nader

programme.title: Death of a Gunfighter
programme.desc: A frontier marshal kills a drunken man in self defence, but finds his uncompromising brand of justice is no longer condoned by the locals. When he refuses to step down, the town fathers realise they may have to use violent methods of their own to rid themselves of him. Western, starring Richard Widmark, Lena Horne, Carroll OConnor and David Opatoshu

programme.title: Backlash
programme.desc: A man searches for the lone survivor of an Indian ambush which claimed the life of his estranged father, but his quest is complicated by the involvement of various interested parties trying to get their hands on a cache of stolen gold. Western, starring Richard Widmark, Donna Reed and John McIntyre

programme.title: Hombre
programme.desc: A white man raised by Apaches joins a stagecoach on a journey across the Arizona desert, but is treated with scorn by his fellow passengers because of his background. However, when they are attacked by bandits, he is the first to stand up and defend the people who hate him. Western, starring Paul Newman, Richard Boone, Fredric March, Diane Cilento and Cameron Mitchell

programme.title: Kiss of the Dragon
programme.desc: A Chinese police officer travels to Paris in search of the head of an international drug ring. However, his target is a corrupt cop who promptly frames him for murder. Fighting to clear his name, he finds an unlikely ally in an American prostitute who offers to testify against the crooked detective in return for help in rescuing her daughter. Martial arts adventure, starring Jet Li and Bridget Fonda

programme.desc: The detective is paired with DC Webster, an officer who is struggling to fit in with life in Denton after being seconded from Scotland, with the duo investigating a robbery at a local casino and a hit-and-run incident involving Roger Massie, the son of a local politician, and soon finds that both matters are linked. programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of a sheep farmer leads Wycliffe into the heart of a rural community whose apparently tranquil surface conceals a desperate struggle for survival. It is not long before he uncovers disturbing evidence suggesting foul play. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Theft of the Royal Ruby
programme.desc: The Belgian detective looks forward to a quiet Christmas, but is disturbed by the Foreign Office when an Egyptian prince loses a famous ruby - after making the mistake of lending it to a mysterious woman. Guest starring Stephanie Cole, Nigel Le Vaillant and Tariq Alibai

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An American female bishop visiting St Gerards College is found dead after drinking poisoned wine, and when another two killings occur, both mirroring macabre murders from Jacobean revenge tragedy, it appears the culprit is targeting candidates in the election to become vice-regent. However, when Innocent learns one of the suspects is hiding a dark secret, Lewis and Hathaway realise the motive is much more twisted. Guest starring Sian Phillips and Ronald Pickup, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: When a respectable GP is found dead in a public lavatory, the young Morses outlandish theories see him relegated to general duties by the newly arrived Chief Superintendent Bright. Humiliated and humbled, Endeavour has to investigate from the sidelines, but its not long before hes questioning DI Fred Thursdays orders and risking his career to avert a family tragedy. Shaun Evans stars, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Goodnight Mister Tom
programme.desc: John Thaw stars in this adaptation of Michelle Magorians wartime novel as Tom Oakley, an irascible widower whose life is changed for ever when nine-year-old London evacuee Willie is billeted in his cottage. The youngster takes to village life and the pair develop a strong bond - which looks set to be broken when Willies tyrannical mother summons him back to the capital. Co-starring Nick Robinson and Annabelle Apsion

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is found strangled. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing. Starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Cliff Parisi

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The body of farmer Alex Preston is found in the middle of the sacred Crowcall stone circle in Midsomer Mow, with new medical examiner Dr Kate Wilding confirming that the victim was disembowelled but that a head injury was the likely cause of death. Suspicion initially falls on local druids led by high priests Ezra Canning and Leticia Clifford, since Prestons plans to plough Gorse Meadow would have barred their access to the site. Barnaby and Jones are joined by Wilding to investigate, and as the case wears on, the inspector becomes convinced greed rather than spiritualism is the motive. Starring Neil Dudgeon, Jason Hughes and Tamzin Malleson

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of a trainee forensic psychologist, whose body has been dumped in a Northumberland landfill site, surroundings that make evidence of how she died impossible to verify. Vera discovers that the dead woman had been working for the prison service re-investigating a crime that a former prisoner had been convicted of, and realises she must finish what the victim started in order to discover who may have wanted her dead. Paul Kaye plays a new pathologist alongside fellow guest star Peter Davison

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A killer starts dumping the bodies of homeless men in the financial district of Bradfield, leaving little for Tony to work on except the bizarre ritualistic nature of the crimes. Oxbridge graduate DI Andy Hall fills in for Alex when she suffers a family bereavement and Kevin moves into Tonys flat to offer police protection when it becomes clear a stalker has the clinical psychologist in his or her sights. Drama, starring Robson Green, with Mark Letheren and John Hopkins

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follows the stories of two women looking for siblings given up for adoption, but for very different reasons. Jeanette Woodyatt wants to find the brother she has never met and who was turned away from the family by her grandmother, while Karen Turnbull yearns to let her twin siblings know that their mother gave them up for adoption so they would have a better life

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Called to investigate the attempted theft of a headless skeleton from an archaeological dig, Wycliffe finds himself forced to deal with landowners whose archaic values are jarringly at odds with the modern world. Detective drama, starring Jack Shepherd

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis struggle to determine whether a death during a college-based clinical trial for a new antidepressant was murder or suicide, and receive little assistance from the institutions evasive psychiatric professor. A second students demise then leads to the revelation that the trials participants are all operating under the influence of a mind-altering drug, and that the lines between love, obsession and madness have become dangerously blurred. Guest starring Douglas Henshall (Primeval), Lucy Liemann (Rev) and Thomas Brodie Sangster (Love Actually)

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Harriet Walter (Law and Order: UK) joins the cast as the costume drama returns. Following Matthews shocking death, new mother Mary is struggling to come to terms with her loss, and Robert and Violet disagree over how to handle the situation. Downstairs, Jimmy finally takes an interest in Ivy, while Carson receives an unwelcome reminder of his past. Mrs Hughes sees a chance to help grief-stricken Isobel, and Thomas has the childrens nanny in his sights. Michelle Dockery, Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Ed Speleers and Phyllis Logan also star

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Mary begins to emerge from her grief, and takes an interest in the running of the estate. However, her ambitions meet firm resistance from her father. Lady Rose MacClare, Lady Flintshires daughter, finds herself in a predicament at a tea dance in York, while Mrs Hughes urges Carson to heal an old wound. Bates comes up with a plan to help Molesley, but will it work? Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Hugh Bonneville, Lily James, Phyllis Logan, Jim Carter, Brendan Coyle and Kevin Doyle

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: An extravagant party at the Abbey gives the Crawleys an opportunity to reunite with old friends. Some guests, however, prove more welcome than others, and alongside the celebrations come skulduggery and heartache. Includes guest appearances by Former EastEnders heart-throb Nigel Harman (Dennis Rickman) and soprano Kiri Te Kanawa, who plays the role of real-life singer Dame Nellie Melba

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Abbeys eventful party, Mary is forced to answer a pressing question about her future, while Carson reveals surprisingly intimate details about his former life. Roses trip to the bright lights of London sees her risking the Crawleys reputation, and Gregson shares ambitious plans with Edith, taking their relationship to another level. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Change is in the air at the Abbey as an exciting opportunity for Alfred creates tension between Ivy and Daisy. Isobel appeals to Violets sense of charity, but it doesnt come without a fight, while Branson considers a new future for himself and baby Sybbie. Raquel Cassidy (Teachers) joins the cast of the costume drama, with Matt Milne, Cara Theobold, Sophie McShera, Penelope Wilton, Maggie Smith and Allen Leech

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse meets his intellectual match when a serial killer haunting the streets of Oxford keeps himself one step ahead of the law and leaves cryptic messages to goad the police. At first glance, it seems to be the work of a deranged lunatic, but the elaborate staging of the crimes suggests method in the madness - and a macabre sharing of the sleuths passion for opera. Starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Members of the Midsomer-in-the-Marsh Ornithological Society fall out when Ralph Ford claims to have spotted a blue-crested hoopoe, meaning he wins the groups year-listing competition. However, their president Patrick Morgan says the rare species could never have been seen so far away from its native Uganda and brands him a cheat. The next day, Barnaby and Jones have a murder case on their hands when Patrick is found dead at the scene of the reported sighting. Guest starring Paul Nicholls and James Dreyfus

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the discovery of an unidentified teenage boys body in a coastal towns shipyard, who is revealed to be listed as a missing person, having absconded from the care of his support worker. Vera discovers that the quiet community where he was found is plagued by a serious drugs problem - despite the fact that the only known dealer in the area has turned his back on crime. The victim could be the answer to the mystery, but a wall of silence surrounds his death. Mark Addy guest stars

programme.title: The Hack
programme.desc: With Andy Coulson now in Downing Street, Nick and Alan team up with the New York Times in an effort to make the hacking scandal catch fire - as new leads are uncovered, Nick and Charlotte work together to find hacking victims who might be brave enough to take on the Murdoch press. Meanwhile, Dave is challenged in the witness box at the Morgan murder trial over his handling of supergrass witnesses. Drama, starring David Tennant

programme.title: The Hack
programme.desc: As the hacking scandal builds momentum, Nick meets with Daves new ally Gordon Brown, who persuades him that there is still work to be done. Nick then teams up with fellow Guardian journalist Amelia Hill, who has a source within the Mets new hacking investigation. Meanwhile, a tip-off from Charlotte Harris leads Nick to wonder if hacking was far more egregious, and the information he discovers next has the potential to blow the hacking scandal wide open.

programme.desc: The documentary following life inside an AandE department returns. Emergency care nurse Tim reflects on his role and describes the impact his GP father had on his life. programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE

Emergency nurse practitioner Louise, who has been nursing for nearly 40 years, shares how the tough times shes experienced in her life enable her to have more empathy with her patients. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Despite her lack of experience, Eleanor is drawn deeper into the case as she, and her newfound mentor, realise that she may be the only person, given her own tortured psyche, who can understand the mind of this singular killer. Thriller, starring Shailene Woodley, Ben Mendelsohn and Ralph Ineson

Thriller, starring Aml Ameen, Colin Morgan, Mark Strong and Felicity Jones

programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer co-operation rather than conflict. programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his close-up examination of the creepy-crawly world, shifting focus to the bugs ultimate invention - the colony. Key residents of these minuscule mega-cities include honey bees, termites, leafcutter ants - who have a knack for farming - and their Argentine cousins, members of a community so vast it spans an entire continent

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough

He also embarks on an ambitious attempt to dive further into the reef than ever before to witness the resilient coral that live down in the depths and see if they hold answers that may help to overcome challenges that lie ahead, as the impact of humans on the reef continues to take its toll

programme.title: Money for Nothing

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. The first arrival at the barn is Eloise McKenna from Kent, who hopes a large alabaster light shade that belongs to her sister can be repaired by art conservator Lucia Scalisi. Leather expert Suzie Fletcher takes a look at an old piano stool, which has been handed down through four generations of a family. Finally, experts Richard Biggs and Dominic Chinea turn their attention to restoring a toy bus and a pair of binoculars

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. The first arrival is Suzanne from London, who hopes that mechanical expert Steve Fletcher can bring a decorative wind-up bird cage that once belonged to her late mother back to its former glory. Church wardens Brian Tidswell and David Dickinson bring in a selection of carved angels for wood restorer Will Kirk to repair. Finally, an old Georgian peat bucket and a surgeons leather case are restored by experts Dominic Chinea and Suzie Fletcher

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Sisters Lauren and Claire bring Timmy the teddy bear into the barn with hopes that toy restorers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell can bring back his sparkle. Having been given to their late father Brian when he was born in the 1960s, the sisters want to give the toy to his grandson Harrison to keep his memory alive. Sukeshi brings in a watch given to her by her mother that symbolises her fight for her daughter to lead an independent life despite her disabilities. Horologist Steve Fletcher teams up with Kirsten Ramsay to try get the watch ticking again. The final visitors to the barn, Kegham and his daughter Karine, bring in a sporting trophy for the attention of silversmith Brenton West. Now aged 97, Kegham won the trophy in the 1950s when he was a part of a tennis club in Cyprus

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Philip Serrell and James Braxton - Day Two

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Philip Serrell and James Braxton - Day Three

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Philip Serrell and James Braxton - Day Five
programme.desc: Antiques experts Philip Serrell and James Braxton begin the fifth and final leg of their road trip in Wales in search of bargains, and its all to play for as they head for an auction showdown in Newport, Shropshire

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi heads to Eastbourne, where she tries to help owner Judith give The Sheldon a new identity to make it stand out from the crowd in an area of stiff competition. Alex needs Judith to decide on what she wants the establishment to be if she is going to get The Sheldon shipshape before the all-important summer season, and suggests a family-friendly BandB is the way to go

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi tries to reverse the fortunes of Warwick Hall in Cumbria, one of her grandest hotels yet, but one suffering from low occupancy and negative feedback. While Alex is initially impressed with what she finds, she soon begins to discover the cracks and realises that she has a few harsh home truths to deliver - can she convince the owners that they need to rebrand themselves as a BandB instead of a hotel?

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey researches his family tree, starting by investigating his great grandfather who fought in the First World War. A trip to the military base in Dorset where he trained, reveals he fought at Gallipoli, one of the deadliest campaigns of the conflict. Tracing back to the late 18th century, Chris revisits the era when his five-times great grandmother was pregnant. This was a time when those lucky enough to pass a rigorous interview and then win a lottery were able to give birth at the British Lying-In Hospital, thus helping ensure their children got a better start in life. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Manville researches her family tree. So far as her mothers side is concerned, by delving deep into Brightons local archives, Lesley uncovers a complex story of wartime separation, adultery and the inaccessibility of divorce. Tracing back her fathers line sees Lesley trying to solve what happened to her ancestor Aaron Harding. A widower with a large family to feed, Aaron protested poor conditions and pay as an agricultural worker in 1830 - a protest that would become known as the Swing Riots. He was arrested and subsequently transported to Australia

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall ,Nicky Campbell and the team help 67-year-old Christine Rose yo search for the sisters she was separated from at the age of four when her mother was prosecuted for neglect. The three young girls were taken by social services during the night and sent to separate childrens homes. Nicky leads the search for Christines sisters and the team makes remarkable discoveries, revealing layers of family that she never knew existed

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr take on their first project - designing a Sicilian kitchen. Kicking off the demolition in 36-degree heat proves to be a trial for Alan, and he soon realises that taking on a build in a medieval hilltop town comes with its own unique challenges. With the help of Project Manager Scott, Amanda barters with the locals at a nearby marble factory as she bags a bargain for their feature island and brushes up on her culinary skills in Marsala, learning how to cook Sicilys signature dish

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The best eight cooks remaining in the semi-finals take on a daunting invention test where they must create a dish inspired by the chicken or the egg. programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build Ireland
programme.desc: Baz Ashmawy and a team of volunteers renovate the home of 17-year-old Kyle from Wicklow Town, who has cerebral palsy and primarily uses a wheelchair to get about. Due to the current layout of the family home, Kyle is unable to use his chair indoors and must rely on tripods. He needs a bigger bedroom, an accessible bathroom, a lift to bring him upstairs, and a more accessible layout downstairs

programme.title: Heat My Home

programme.title: Best Place to Be
programme.desc: Baz Ashmawy travels to Cyprus and meets cafe owners Kevin OReilly and Rachel Watchorn OReilly from Dublin, who moved to the Middle Eastern country to get away from the corporate world. Baz also speaks to 46-year-old Trish Browne, who left Cork for Cyprus when she was just 21, as well as Andrew Shanahan from Kerry, who relocated with his Cypriot wife

programme.title: Attack on the Iron Coast
programme.desc: A Canadian major leads a commando attack against a German naval base on the French coast. However, his troubled past and conflict with a fellow officer place the operation in jeopardy, leaving them battling to put their personal problems aside and focus on survival. Second World War drama, starring Lloyd Bridges, Andrew Keir, Sue Lloyd and Mark Eden.

programme.title: Build Your Own Home
programme.desc: Clare Islands community centre is at the heart of the island, a multipurpose space that caters for all occasions from deaths, births, communions, workouts and marriages - and everything in between. But manager Maureen Pinder says the building cannot cope with the demands placed upon it and the island is losing revenue as a result. So the team set to work to improve the centre and what it offers, in the hope of attracting young people back to the island during the busy tourist season

programme.title: Planet Earth III
programme.desc: David Attenborough journeys into the hidden world of forests, from the temperate rainforests of Canada, where rarely seen spirit bears fish for salmon, to the teak forests of India, where whistling wild dogs work together to bring down prey three times their size. In the misty mountainous forests of China, male tragopan have developed a comical dance routine, whilst in the dense tropical rainforest, treehoppers form surprising alliances to fight off assassin bugs and oriental pied hornbills go to incredible lengths to protect their young

programme.title: Nobody
programme.desc: A quiet and unassuming family man slowly reveals his true character after his house is burgled by two petty thieves. Crime drama, starring Bob Odenkirk, Connie Nielsen and Aleksey Serebryakov

programme.title: Attack on Pearl Harbor: Minute by Minute
programme.sub-title: Attack on Pearl Harbor: Caught by Surprise
programme.desc: A detailed account of the Japanese attacks on the US naval base in December 1941, beginning with the inception of the idea and the obstacles it faced during the months of planning. Some of the survivors of that day share their stories, including a 103-year-old Japanese torpedo bomber, who is interviewed for the first time, and an American sailor who was on the USS Arizona when it was hit by a bomb that ignited its ammunition magazine, killing 1,177 men
